pr_title: [1.15.x] DataGenerator for LootTable, replacing shears item to shears tag

timeline.message: DataGenerator for LootTable, replacing shears item to shears tag

timeline.bodyText: Using access transformers might be better here, but involves removing final keyword
timeline.author: percivalalb

replies.bodyText: I dont think it will be better, if that changes will be visible for modders
replies.author: yanny7

replies.bodyText: probably better to add a getter, and then replace the whole Inverted instance instead of just the term inside.
replies.author: LexManos

timeline.bodyText: Depending on field order doesn't feel very safe, is there a reason this is used over ObfuscationReflectionHelper or a simple Access Transformer?
timeline.author: ichttt

replies.bodyText:
That's also what's happening in ForgeRecipeProvider, where obtaining the list or map of ingredients relies on the field ordering (why?). There should be a common consensus on the approach to follow.
IMO ObfuscationReflectionHelper should be preferred over ATs (since these data Gens don't run at runtime and we don't really need to expose data) and field ordering.
replies.author: TheSilkMiner

replies.bodyText: I was using ForgeRecipeProvider as example, but I can replace that by method from ObfuscationReflectionHelper
replies.author: yanny7

timeline.bodyText: Should probably note that this is used for shears only right now
timeline.author: ichttt
